key_points: Hurricane Ida hit Louisiana as a Category 4 storm, causing widespread power outages including all of New Orleans.
Ida was blamed for at least one death due to a fallen tree on a home in Prairieville.
The power outage in New Orleans heightened concerns over flooding and left residents without air conditioning in the heat.
Ida made landfall on the 16-year anniversary of Hurricane Katrina, sharing a similar path.
Significant flooding and calls for boat rescues were reported in LaPlace, near Lake Pontchartrain.
More than 1 million customers in Louisiana and over 40,000 in Mississippi lost power.
Ida's storm surge reversed the flow of the Mississippi River and caused damage, including roofs blown off buildings.
No mandatory evacuation was ordered for New Orleans due to the storm's swift intensification.
The storm impacts areas important for petrochemical sites and major ports, already under strain from COVID-19.
The storm threatens weeks of recovery, with widespread damage and impacts on critical infrastructure.
spokespersons: Ricky Boyette (U.S. Army Corps of Engineers spokesman)
Greg Langley (Louisiana Department of Environmental Quality spokesman)
